snippet: Our series on Marfa artists kicks off with the artist collective-cum-band Foundation for Jammable Resources.
abstract: Our series on Marfa artists kicks off with the artist collective-cum-band Foundation for Jammable Resources.

byline.original: By VINCENT DILIO AND CHRIS WALLACE

lead_paragraph: Foundation for Jammable Resources is an artist collective-cum-band whose shows blend installation, punk and performance art. Its members - many of whom hail from California or Texas and earn paychecks in restaurants - have all been in Marfa, Tex., for about five years. Carlos Lujan and John Rayburn have played music together for 12 years and met Anthony DeSimone 4 years ago in the local scene. They started jamming together at parties, realized they had a lot in common and ultimately had a drum war in front of the Ballroom late one night during a Chinati Open House weekend. They started playing and experimenting with music with John Rayburn and decided they liked what they were doing and wanted to play live. They played a party at Jeff Elrod's studio on the Sunday night of Chinati weekend (a night for locals to get together after all the tourists have left) and an amazing thing happened...

headline.main: The Real Artists of Marfa | Foundation for Jammable Resources
